page.shortlink: api sql namespace connection class insert data function
page.description: Apply new rows to a table in the currently connected database using a result set.
page.syntax: Rows_Added as N = InsertData(TableOwner as C, TableName as C, ResultSet as SQL::ResultSet [, EventScript as C [, ReplicateIdentity = .f. as L]])

argument.name: Rows_Added
argument.description: The number of new rows added.

argument.name: TableName
argument.description: The name of the table to receive the data.

argument.name: ResultSet
argument.description: A SQL::ResultSet object that contains transactions to apply.

argument.name: EventScript
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". An Xbasic Script implementing any of the following functions. In each case, the Context argument is the connection itself.

page.discussion: The InsertData() method adds new rows to a table in the currently connected database using a result set. Note: If ReplicateIdentity is set to .T., identity column values are included in the insert and must be supplied when the SQL is executed.
